intro: Centipeda pleiocephala, commonly known as the common centipeda, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow or white. Centipeda pleiocephala is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
